content:
• Thursday, August 11, 2011
  • JWN

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q2 earnings jumped 20% as the upscale retailer continued to report...

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q2 earnings jumped 20% as the upscale retailer continued to report designer merchandise was among its top sellers. The company notes that consumers are purchasing full price merchandise at levels not seen since 2007. Shares +3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • ELX

    Emulex (NYSE:ELX), a maker of enterprise storage adapter cards, is down 7% AH after reporting...

    Emulex (NYSE:ELX), a maker of enterprise storage adapter cards, is down 7% AH after reporting FQ4 results. Though revenue of $123.4M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16 beat consensus by $3.6M and $0.06, FQ1 guidance of $114M-$118M in revenue and $0.10-$0.12 in EPS is below a consensus of $124.1M and $0.15. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • MCPIQ

    More on Molycorp (MCP): the rare-earth miner posts a solid Q2 on sharply higher metals prices...

    More on Molycorp (MCP): the rare-earth miner posts a solid Q2 on sharply higher metals prices and a boost in sales volume from the contributions of two new subsidiaries the company acquired in April. Shares +7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • ATGE

    More on DeVry (DV): FQ4 beats on all both EPS and revenues, but, tracking with the current trend...

    More on DeVry (DV): FQ4 beats on all both EPS and revenues, but, tracking with the current trend in for-profit colleges reporting this quarter, the stock is trading lower on a sharp drop in student enrollment. Shares -10% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • NVDA

    More on Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): Q2 solidly beats with record gross margins, boosted by strong...

    More on Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): Q2 solidly beats with record gross margins, boosted by strong demand for its Optimus technology products. The company raises guidance, now seeing Q3 revenue in the range of $1.05B - $1.07B, versus Street expectations of $1.05B. Shares +18% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • DAR

    Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q2 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $471M (+183% Y/Y)...

    Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q2 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $471M (+183% Y/Y) beats by $19M. Shares -2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • EPAY

    Bottomline Technologies (NASDAQ:EPAY): reports FQ4 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.04. Revenues of $54M...

    Bottomline Technologies (NASDAQ:EPAY): reports FQ4 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.04. Revenues of $54M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Gross margins +25% Y/Y on strong top-line sales in all units. Shares +9.8% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) finishes the day 11.8% higher after being upgraded by Goldman on...

    Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) finishes the day 11.8% higher after being upgraded by Goldman on valuation earlier in the day. Despite market volatility, the investment bank believes oil spare capacity will remain tight, driving Brent prices higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • LTRE

    Learning Tree International (OTC:LTRE -13%) closes near its lows after FQ3 EPS came in at half...

    Learning Tree International (OTC:LTRE -13%) closes near its lows after FQ3 EPS came in at half of what analysts' were expecting. Although revenues were slightly better Y/Y, operating costs soared on higher admin expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CTAS

    Corporate uniform provider Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS) is up 8% on the day, as StreetInsider.com...

    Corporate uniform provider Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS) is up 8% on the day, as StreetInsider.com reports CEO Scott D. Farmer has bought a whopping 650K shares. Insider buying activity has been fairly strong during the market's plunge.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • CENX

    Century Aluminum (CENX +14%) continues to gain after announcing a $60M stock repurchase program...

    Century Aluminum (CENX +14%) continues to gain after announcing a $60M stock repurchase program earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +11.1%) is bouncing today thanks to a WSJ column stating members of Sprint's...

    Clearwire (CLWR +11.1%) is bouncing today thanks to a WSJ column stating members of Sprint's (NYSE:S) board "expect the company to make a substantial investment in Clearwire." Shares had fallen nearly 75% since May on the Sprint-Lightsquared deal, weak earnings, and fears the company will run out of money in 2012. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • CVX

    After dropping more than 15% since last month, Chevron (CVX +4.4%) shares look too cheap to...

    After dropping more than 15% since last month, Chevron (CVX +4.4%) shares look too cheap to ignore, prompting an upgrade and higher target price from Oppenheimer. After spending heavily on capital projects, CVX plans to start boosting its production by 4%-5% a year, a rate that would be highest among its peers. Energy stocks are up across the board today, as futures rally 3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • WCC

    Industrial maintenance supplier Wesco International (NYSE:WCC) gains +13.5% today after KeyBanc...

    Industrial maintenance supplier Wesco International (NYSE:WCC) gains +13.5% today after KeyBanc ups it to buy on valuation, citing confidence in management's ability to execute on its strategic initiatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • DRI

    Darden Restaurants (DRI +8.4%) adds to gains late in the day after saying earlier it will expand...

    Darden Restaurants (DRI +8.4%) adds to gains late in the day after saying earlier it will expand its Red Lobster, Olive Garden and Capital Grille brands into Mexico under an area-development agreement with Corporacion Mexicana (OTC:CPMXF).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • DAN

    Shares of Dana holding (DAN +15.1%) soar on volume 2X normal trading. Insiders got the party...

    Shares of Dana holding (DAN +15.1%) soar on volume 2X normal trading. Insiders got the party started for the automotive manufacturer supplier earlier this week with their own buying spree.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW +2.5%) reverses course, following a -9% slump at the open after...

    Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW +2.5%) reverses course, following a -9% slump at the open after its Q2 earnings plunged 73% on sharply higher operating costs. Investors appear to be focused on growth, as the company expands coverage in over 18 markets covering more than 50 ports since it went public in late 2006.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +4.1%) cuts the price of its TouchPad tablet by 20% less than two months...

    Hewlett-Packard (HPQ +4.1%) cuts the price of its TouchPad tablet by 20% less than two months after it hit stores. The Wi-Fi version with 16 gigabytes will now cost $399, and the 32g version will cost $499, each $100 less than comparable iPads (NASDAQ:AAPL). H-P had lowered prices as part of a back-to-school promotion, but the cuts are now permanent.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • KELYA

    The better-than-expected jobless number today is buoying shares of staffing firms. Firms showing...

    The better-than-expected jobless number today is buoying shares of staffing firms. Firms showing gains include Kelly Services (KELYA +12.9%), Manpower Group (MAN +3.1%), Robert Half International (RHI +4.9%), SFN Group (SFN +2.2%) and CTG (CTGX +4.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • GEVO

    Renewable chemicals and biofuels developer Gevo (GEVO -8%) is falling on news of BP and DuPont's...

    Renewable chemicals and biofuels developer Gevo (GEVO -8%) is falling on news of BP and DuPont's (DD) Butamax JV filing a lawsuit against the company. The suit accuses Gevo of violating a Butamax patent regarding the production of a biofuel called isobutanol. Gevo asserts Butamax's patent is "invalid and not infringed."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • VEOEY

    Shares of French utility Veolia Environnement (VE +11%) continue to gain ground after BofA...

    Shares of French utility Veolia Environnement (VE +11%) continue to gain ground after BofA Merrill Lynch ups it to buy on valuation earlier today. Merrill says the company is making decent headway in its strategic initiative to become smaller and more profitable.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • WEN

    Wendy's (WEN +8.3%) shares sizzle as Q2 same-store sales jumped 2.3%, a full point better than...

    Wendy's (WEN +8.3%) shares sizzle as Q2 same-store sales jumped 2.3%, a full point better than estimates, as patrons keep coming despite economic uncertainty. A strong second-half outlook supports Janney's belief that Wendy's is on its way to passing Burger King as the no. 2 burger chain. Among other eateries: MCD +1.9%, EAT +13.8%, YUM +5.9%, THI +4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • TPCG

    TPC Group (TPCG +18.8%) jumps after it's Q2 profits handily beat estimates. Revenue soared a...

    TPC Group (TPCG +18.8%) jumps after it's Q2 profits handily beat estimates. Revenue soared a record 49% to $792M on a jump in average sales margins due to soaring commodity prices and strong polyethylene demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • LVS

    Casino stocks (BJK +4.5%) post healthy gains across the board after a harsh selloff this week....

    Casino stocks (BJK +4.5%) post healthy gains across the board after a harsh selloff this week. Analysts see gaming companies with China-operations looking ripe to outperform U.S.-centric firms likely to be dragged down by wary consumers. Gainers: LVS +7.4%, MGM +5.9%, MPEL +10.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CHUX

    Casual-dining chain O'Charley's (CHUX +1%) stages a nice turnaround after an -11% dip early in...

    Casual-dining chain O'Charley's (CHUX +1%) stages a nice turnaround after an -11% dip early in the day. The company posted a wider-than-expected Q2 EPS loss, but revenue beat estimates. Following a brief selloff at the open, the stock has bounced back and continues to drift higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • TLB

    Struggling women's apparel retailer Talbots (NYSE:TLB) gains 23.9% three days after private...

    Struggling women's apparel retailer Talbots (NYSE:TLB) gains 23.9% three days after private equity firm Sycamore Partners disclosed a 9.9% stake, and two days after the company adopted a "poison pill" shareholder rights plan to prevent a hostile takeover. In spite of the latter event, investors appear to be speculating the company will be a buyout target.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • TLT

    Treasury prices plummet after the 30 year auction moves paper at 3.75% vs. the 3.64% it had been...

    Treasury prices plummet after the 30 year auction moves paper at 3.75% vs. the 3.64% it had been trading at before the sale; the yield now moving to 3.77%. TLT -5.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • NKA

    Niska Gas Storage (NYSE:NKA) falls 17.9% after reporting FQ1 of $45.8M (+10% Y/Y) and...

    Niska Gas Storage (NYSE:NKA) falls 17.9% after reporting FQ1 of $45.8M (+10% Y/Y) and EPSof $0.07 - while the latter beat consensus by $0.03, the former missed by $8.3M. The company says "market conditions remain challenging and have continued to deteriorate." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • ENTR

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR) gains +10.5% today, after Wunderlich intitiates coverage...

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR) gains +10.5% today, after Wunderlich intitiates coverage with a buy rating, saying the company's competitive position and end market potential in the U.S. market will continue to grow.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • NAVB

    Neoprobe (NEOP +4.8%) shares are higher today after submitting a new drug application to the FDA...

    Neoprobe (NEOP +4.8%) shares are higher today after submitting a new drug application to the FDA for its cancer detection platform Lymphoseek. The company seeks clearance to market it for use in surgical oncology procedures.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • INTC

    Shares of Altera (ALTR +4.8%) move higher, pulled along by a surge in networking stocks and a...

    Shares of Altera (ALTR +4.8%) move higher, pulled along by a surge in networking stocks and a timely upgrade from Barclays to Overweight from Equal Weight.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +38%) soars after General Motors (GM +4%) awards the lithium-ion battery...

    A123 Systems (AONE +38%) soars after General Motors (GM +4%) awards the lithium-ion battery developer an extended production contract. The company will provide advanced nanophosphate cells and fully integrated electronic components to the auto-maker, as it ramps up efforts to integrate electric technology into its fleet of cars.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • RDEN

    Elizabeth Arden (RDEN +8.8%) trades higher after reporting FQ4 earnings more than doubled,...

    Elizabeth Arden (RDEN +8.8%) trades higher after reporting FQ4 earnings more than doubled, easily beating estimates. The beauty-product maker's revenue stream continues to benefit from strong demand across all product lines in North America, and its focus on higher-margin cosmetics sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM

  • Natural gas futures gain 3.5% after an energy report shows inventories rose much less than...

    Natural gas futures gain 3.5% after an energy report shows inventories rose much less than expected last week, coming in at 25 bcf vs. 34-38 bcf consensus. Inventories now sit close to 3% lower than the 5-year average. Natural gas fund movers: UNL +1%, GAZ +3%, UNG +2.6%, DCNG +2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • CARB

    After seeing their offering price lowered to $10, shares of cloud storage provider Carbonite...

    After seeing their offering price lowered to $10, shares of cloud storage provider Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) opened for trading at $10.93, and are now changing hands at $11.80. That's good for an 18% gain and a market cap of $294M (assuming underwriters fully exercised overallotment options). (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +4.7%) pops after Duncan-Williams ups it to buy on valuation....

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +4.7%) pops after Duncan-Williams ups it to buy on valuation. The firm cites the company's healthy balance sheet and solid customer base, adding it's a core holding for investors wanting to participate in the outsourcing trend among healthcare providers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • KCG

    Among financial names showing strength are three Goldman Sachs added to its Conviction Buy list...

    Among financial names showing strength are three Goldman Sachs added to its Conviction Buy list this morning: Knight Capital (KCG +7.2%), Nasdaq (NDAQ +4.9%), BlackRock (BLK +3.5%). Goldman upgraded these financials to Buy from Neutral: ICE +5.1%, OZM +5.4%, BEN +2.6%, GFIG +10.7%, AIZ +3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • MOS

    Agricultural stocks are outperforming the market today, as prices for corn, soybean, wheat, and...

    Agricultural stocks are outperforming the market today, as prices for corn, soybean, wheat, and other commodities shoot higher. MOS +8.1%. POT +5.4%. AGU +3.3%. MON +4.8%. DE +6%. CF +8.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • QNST

    Online ad services company QuinStreet (NASDAQ:QNST) gains 15.6% after reporting FQ4 revenue of...

    Online ad services company QuinStreet (NASDAQ:QNST) gains 15.6% after reporting FQ4 revenue of $94.1M (+6% Y/Y) and EPSof $0.24, beating consensus by $2.3M and $0.06. Gross margin declined to 26.6% from 29% in FQ4 2010. Growth was driven by a 12% Y/Y increase in sales for the company's Education client vertical. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +6.9%) trades higher, outperforming other tech stocks, as shares come off of 2-year...

    Yahoo (YHOO +6.9%) trades higher, outperforming other tech stocks, as shares come off of 2-year lows. A few pesky insiders decided to bottom-dip and buy this week according to SEC filings.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • NWS

    Today's surge in News Corp. (NWS +17.6%) now tops Cisco (CSCO +17.2%) among S&P stocks, as...

    Today's surge in News Corp. (NWS +17.6%) now tops Cisco (CSCO +17.2%) among S&P stocks, as FQ4 earnings and revenue easily beat expectations, plus a promise of an accelerated share buyback and minimal acquisitions - "the best answer we can imagine to 'hack-lash,'" a Lazard analyst says. Rupert Murdoch says COO Chase Carey is next in line.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • BUD

    Shares of Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD +3.3%) rally after the firm's Q2 report highlights gains it...

    Shares of Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD +3.3%) rally after the firm's Q2 report highlights gains it reaped from merger synergies and aggressive cost-cutting, but what's next? The WSJ's Matthew Dalton ponders how the brewer can keep profits rolling with little room to cut more or raise prices to strapped Americans?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • S

    The market swoon is especially bad timing for Sprint (S -3.8%), the S&P's biggest loser so...

    The market swoon is especially bad timing for Sprint (S -3.8%), the S&P's biggest loser so far, which faces demands for cash just as the cost and difficulty of borrowing have risen. Sprint must pay off $2.3B in debt next March, begin work on a $4B-$5B network modernization project, and may need to make a big investment to support partner Clearwire (CLWR).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • HSH

    Sara Lee (SLE -2.6%) regains some of its earlier losses, but is still down on the day after its...

    Sara Lee (SLE -2.6%) regains some of its earlier losses, but is still down on the day after its FQ4 missed consensus estimates. Earnings slid 41% on a sharp drop in sales due to rising prices. Looking forward, the company continues to see cost pressures on its bottom line, and lowers its FY12 revenue guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

  • European shares roaring now, at their highs of the day as a short-selling ban seems imminent....

    European shares roaring now, at their highs of the day as a short-selling ban seems imminent. Stoxx (FEZ) 50 +3%. The biggest winner is Switzerland (EWL), +5% as the franc (FXF -4.7%) craters against the euro and the dollar.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • CECE

    CECO Environmental (CECE +17.5%) is higher this morning after its Q2 EPS beat estimates on...

    CECO Environmental (CECE +17.5%) is higher this morning after its Q2 EPS beat estimates on better operating margins and lower admin costs. The company also approved a stock buyback program of up to 500K shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • EAT

    Brinker International (NYSE:EAT), which owns the Chili's and Maggiano's restaurant brands, is up...

    Brinker International (NYSE:EAT), which owns the Chili's and Maggiano's restaurant brands, is up 10.9% after reporting FQ4 revenue of $717.5M (-3% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.48, beating consensus by $6.9M and $0.01. Comparable restaurant sales increased 2.6% Y/Y. The company expects FQ2 revenue growth of 2-3%, slightly above a 1.8% consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • XOM

    Shares of Exxon (NYSE:XOM) are halted after hitting circuit breakers on a 6.7% drop from what...

    Shares of Exxon (NYSE:XOM) are halted after hitting circuit breakers on a 6.7% drop from what appears to be a fat finger. Update at 10:42: Shares resume trading +2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM

  • European shares get another jolt higher as CNBC reports senior government sources saying Italy...

    European shares get another jolt higher as CNBC reports senior government sources saying Italy and France will impose a short-selling ban after the close of trading today. France +1.7%, more than 5% higher than its level 2 hours ago. Italy +3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 4 Comments
  • SODA

    Home soda machine maker SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) is down 30.8% after reporting Q2 results. While...

    Home soda machine maker SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) is down 30.8% after reporting Q2 results. While revenue of $77.4M (+38% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.42 was well ahead of a consensus of $50.1M and $0.22, guidance for 30% 2011 revenue growth falls short of a 32.6% consensus. Though sales to the Americas are surging, European sales growth appears to be slowing down.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +3.7%) receives an upgrade from Stifel to Buy from Hold with a...

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +3.7%) receives an upgrade from Stifel to Buy from Hold with a price target of $42 on shares. The engineering and construction concern has also seen both Barclays and Credit Suisse raise EPS estimates recently on the strength of the firm's order backlog.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • BGG

    Briggs & Stratton (BGG -14.7%) takes a hit after its FQ4 swings to a loss on lower sales and...

    Briggs & Stratton (BGG -14.7%) takes a hit after its FQ4 swings to a loss on lower sales and an impairment charge. Gross profit fell on a 4.7% dip in engine sales, and poor weather conditions contributed to a 13% decline in shipment volumes. The company lowers FY12 EPS guidance to a range of $1.05 to $1.25, far below analysts' estimates of $1.52.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • ACTV

    Shares of Active Networks (ACTV +5.5%) gain after reporting Q2 earnings last night, missing...

    Shares of Active Networks (ACTV +5.5%) gain after reporting Q2 earnings last night, missing analyst EPS estimates by $0.04 on revenue of $99M (+21% Y/Y). The software firm sees Q3 revenue in the range of $84M-$88M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • ARMH

    Goldman is adding ARM (ARMH +4.3%) to its Conviction Buy list, believing its recent decline...

    Goldman is adding ARM (ARMH +4.3%) to its Conviction Buy list, believing its recent decline presents a buying opportunity, and that adoption of the company's processor designs in the phone and computing markets will lead to higher royalty rates. Goldman's target for ARM's U.K. shares represents a 51% premium from current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • OTEX

    Open Text (OTEX -16.7%) shares slide as margins decline, and earnings and revenue fall short of...

    Open Text (OTEX -16.7%) shares slide as margins decline, and earnings and revenue fall short of estimates. Susquehanna downgrades the stock and cuts its price target, expecting ”incremental” execution risks as OTEX integrates its MetaStorm acquisition while “a growing portion of its deals are projects that we believe are more discretionary and lower in IT priority.”

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • CSCO

    Networking and telecom hardware vendors, and the component suppliers who service them, are...

    Networking and telecom hardware vendors, and the component suppliers who service them, are joining Cisco (CSCO +16.2%) in strongly outperforming the NASDAQ. JNPR +4.8%. JDSU +6.3%. CAVM +9.6%. NETL +7.4%. APKT +6.6%. PMCS +4.5%. OPLK +4.9%. ALU +3.2%. FFIV +3.5%. BRCD +4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • AMSC

    Troubled wind turbine component maker American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) falls another 5%...

    Troubled wind turbine component maker American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) falls another 5% after announcing it expects to report FQ2 revenue of less than $10M, well below the $45.1M consensus. The company also states it has cut its workforce by roughly 30% since 3/31, and will be eliminating an additional 150 positions.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • AONEQ

    Premarket gainers: AONE +20%. CSCO +12%. EAT +11%. NWS +8%. AKS +5%. CLWR +5%. MPEL +5%. KSS...

    Premarket gainers: AONE +20%. CSCO +12%. EAT +11%. NWS +8%. AKS +5%. CLWR +5%. MPEL +5%. KSS +5%. NVDA +5%. BX +4%. BAC +4%. ALU +4%. ETFC +4%. DRYS +4%. PBR +4%. CAJ +4%. ARMH +4%. SID +4%. ASX +4%. RF +4%. VALE +3%. MGM +4%. LYG +3%. MOS +3%. CREE +3%. ASML +3%. BRFS +3%. GS +3%. SINA +3%. BHP +3%. ITUB +3%. POT +3%. ERIC +3%.
    Losers: SODA -10%. SLE -8%. AMSC -7%. ALLY -5%. NVS -4%. LOGI -4%. CRH -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • The floated ban on short selling in Europe is having the desired effect, with shares rallying...

    The floated ban on short selling in Europe is having the desired effect, with shares rallying sharply. Stoxx 50 -0.8% after being down 3.5% at the time of the report. If memory serves, U.S. shares had a jaw-dropping rally in 2008 on a similar ban, resuming their steep decline shortly after.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • KSS

    More on Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) Q2 report: Same-store sales rose 1.9% Y/Y in Q2. FY11 EPS guidance...

    More on Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) Q2 report: Same-store sales rose 1.9% Y/Y in Q2. FY11 EPS guidance above $4.40 consensus, in spite of Q3 sales growth forecast of 4-6% falling short of 6.1% consensus. EPS forecast is boosted by the company's plans to repurchase $500M in shares in Q3. KSS +3.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    Shares of CREE (NASDAQ:CREE) move 2% higher premarket, boosted by an upgrade from Morgan Stanley...

    Shares of CREE (NASDAQ:CREE) move 2% higher premarket, boosted by an upgrade from Morgan Stanley to Overweight from Underweight. The firm raises its price target for the LED manufacturer to $40 from $28, citing stabilizing margins and a growth in its branded lighting systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • AOL

    With AOL shares at their lowest levels since the company's 2009 IPO, its board has authorized a...

    With AOL shares at their lowest levels since the company's 2009 IPO, its board has authorized a $250M stock repurchase program. Given AOL had a market cap of just $1.09B at yesterday's close, the program could be highly accretive to earnings if fully seen through. Shares are up 5.2% premarket. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 1 Comment

    Anheuser-Busch Inbev (NYSE:BUD) reports Q2 profits of $1.45B (+26% Y/Y) on revenue of $9.95B...

    Anheuser-Busch Inbev (NYSE:BUD) reports Q2 profits of $1.45B (+26% Y/Y) on revenue of $9.95B (+8% Y/Y). Organic sales miss estimates 3.7% vs. 4.9% consensus. Strong sales in Asia offset slower growth in the U.S., Brazil and parts of Europe. The firm says the World Cup last year pushed up comparables. Shares -2.5% premarket.

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) is up 11.1% premarket as the Street voices its approval of the company's results and guidance. Investors could also be pleased with how order growth for Cisco's switches and routers easily surpassed revenue growth, perhaps a sign that upgrades to its Catalyst 6500 switches and ASR 9000 routers are being well-received.
